#Text=Football : Everton defeat Fulham 4-1 at Goodison Park
#Text=Friday , April 6 , 2007
#Text=Everton FC
#Text=4
#Text=1
#Text=Fulham FC
#Text=Match Stats
#Text=Attendance

#Text=35612 Goalscorers for Everton FC Carsley ( 25 ' ) , Stubbs ( 34 ' ) , Vaughan ( 45 ' ) , Anichebe ( 80 ' ) Goalscorers for Fulham FC Bocanegra ( 22 ' ) Bookings ( Everton FC ) None Bookings ( Fulham FC ) None
#Text=Everton came from behind to thrash Fulham 4-1 on Friday at Goodison Park .
#Text=Everton had a chance to jump into fifth place in the league ahead of Bolton , while Fulham could have jumped from fifteenth all the way to eleventh , boosting their chances of league survival .

#Text=England international Andy Johnson was paired with 18 year old James Vaughan up front for Everton , while Chris Coleman 's Fulham had a full North American strike force through American Bryan McBride and Canadian Thomasz Radzinski .
#Text=The visitors started the game strongly with long range efforts from Rosenior and Smertin , but neither were able to bother Tim Howard in the Everton goal .
#Text=Mikel Arteta was able to trouble Antti Niemi , however , in the Fulham goal , but the Finnish keeper did well to keep the ball out of the bottom corner .
#Text=Carlos Bocanegra then opened Everton wide open as he stole away from the defenders and headed home Simon Davies ' cross , giving Fulham the lead after 22 minutes .
#Text=Everton answered back quickly through Lee Carsley after Joleon Lescott 's ball found him in the box , and Carsley knocked home the equalizing goal .

#Text=Everton put Fulham on the back foot after their goal , and shoul have taken the lead when a nice interchange of play between Vaughan and Johnson left Vaughaun all alone on net , but his shot was hit off the post , and bobbled safely to a Fulham defender .
#Text=Everton were then awarded a free kick in the Fulham zone , and Mikel Arteta stepped up to take .
#Text=His outswinging ball was glanced off the head of Alan Stubbs , and it somehow eluded Niemi , as the homeside took the lead .
#Text=Vaughaun would hit the post again several minutes later , but he finally notched him name on the scoresheet just before the break .
#Text=Arteta and Johnson made room on the left side , and Arteta 's cross was finished well by the young Vaughan , giving Everton a demanding 3-1 lead .
#Text=After the break , Fulham came out strongly , eager to get back into the match .
#Text=McBride had two good chances from headers , but he was unable to find the net on either .
#Text=Zat Knight then had a chance for Fulham , but the cottagers where again unable to get their attempts on target .
#Text=Vuaghan was soon replaced by fellow youngster Victor Anichebe , and he made a nearly instant impact .
#Text=Anichebee received a pass within the box , and he cooly side-footed the ball hard and low past Niemi , leaving the keeper no chance , and guaranteeing Everton the win on the afternoon .
#Text=Substitute Helguson had two chances in quick succession for Fulham , but it was n't to be their day , as the cottagers drop dangerously into relegation contention .
#Text=Everton 's next match in the league is in only 3 days time against Bolton , who are now in sixth place after the Toffee 's win .
#Text=Fulham on the other hand will be facing off with fellow relegation contenders Manchester City at Craven Cottage , and it is looking up to be a true relegation six-pointer .
